data: ED Venous Thrombosis Treatment (DVT or PE) (Patient Being Discharged Home)
Patient Care
Patient Education
Provide patient with follow up instructions in relation to Thrombosis follow up
Medications
Refer to evidence link for Special Authority Forms

For patients with a contraindication to direct oral anticoagulation (such as eGFR less than 30 mL/min, liver cirrhosis, pregnant or breast feeding, body weight greater than 120 kg or impaired GI absorption) use Low Molecular Weight Heparin or page Thrombosis physician to discuss anticoagulation management

enoxaparin for eGFR 30 mL/min or greater and weight 100 kg or less:  
- enoxaparin is dosed at 1.5 mg/kg subcutaneous qdaily

enoxaparin for eGFR 30 mL/min or greater and weight greater than 100 kg:  
- enoxaparin is dosed at 1 mg/kg subcutaneous BID and arrangements should be made for patients to receive BID dosing after discharge   
- Where BID dosing is not feasible, may select dalteparin for once daily dosing
